xxl.core.relational
Class QueryTranslator

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.relational.QueryTranslator

public class QueryTranslator
extends Object

This class provides mechanisms for translating logical query graphs into physical queries. It contains factory methods for adapters building bridges between active and passive query processing and translating the elements of a query graph like operators or predicates to physical implementations.

The whole query translation depends on a central switch function holding the factory methods for element translations and managing the access of them. In order to extend the the query translation engine for being able to translate a superset of query graph elements, simply a factory method for translating the new elements has to be added to the switch function.

Such a factory method must translate an element of the logical query graph into an appropriate implementation. In order to support both active (xxl.core.pipes) and passive (xxl.core.relational) query processing the result of such a factory method must be a metadata provider for composite metadata delivering tuples.

Field Detail

switchFunction

protected Switch<Object,MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>> switchFunction
A switch function holding the factory methods that are used for translating the elements of a query graph. New factory methods can simply be added to this switch function for supporting a larger set of query graphs.

Constructor Detail

QueryTranslator

public QueryTranslator()
Method Detail

getCursor

public static <I,O> MetaDataCursor<O,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> getCursor(Source<? extends I> source,
                                                                                 Function<? super I,? extends O> mapping,
                                                                                 Queue<O> queue,
                                                                                 Function<?,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> metadataFactory)
Adapts an active query processing operator for its use inside a passive query graph. The source's elements are mapped using the given mapping function and inserted into the specified queue. Thereafter a cursor based on the queue's elements is created and finally completed by the metadata generated by the specified factory method before it is returned.

Type Parameters:
I - the type of the source's elements.
O - the type of the cursor's elements.
Parameters:
source - the source providing the elements the cursor's elements are based on.
mapping - the mapping function used for mapping the source's elements to the cursor's elements.
queue - the queue used for storing the source's mapped elements.
metadataFactory - a factory that is used for generating the cursor's metadata.
Returns:
a cursor providing the mapped content of the given source.

getCursor

public static <I,O> MetaDataCursor<O,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> getCursor(Source<? extends TemporalObject<I>> source,
                                                                                 Function<? super TemporalObject<I>,? extends O> mapping,
                                                                                 Function<?,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> metadataFactory)
Adapts an active query processing operator for its use inside a passive query graph. The source's temporal elements are mapped to objects using the given mapping function and inserted into the specified queue. Thereafter a cursor based on the queue's elements is created and finally completed by the metadata generated by the specified factory method before it is returned.

Type Parameters:
I - the type of the source's elements.
O - the type of the cursor's elements.
Parameters:
source - the source providing the elements the cursor's temporal elements are based on.
mapping - the mapping function used for mapping the source's temporal elements to the cursor's elements.
metadataFactory - a factory that is used for generating the cursor's metadata.
Returns:
a cursor providing the mapped content of the given source.

getCursor

public static MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> getCursor(Source<? extends TemporalObject<Tuple>> source,
                                                                               String startTimestampColumnName,
                                                                               String endTimestampColumnName,
                                                                               CompositeMetaData<Object,Object> globalMetaData)
Adapts an active query processing operator for its use inside a passive query graph. The content (tuples) of the source's temporal tuples are enriched by its start and end timestamps. Thereafter a cursor based on this tuples is created and finally completed by the source's relational metadata enriched by two columns of SQL type Types.TIMESTAMP before it is returned.

Parameters:
source - the source providing the temporal tuples the cursor's elements are based on.
startTimestampColumnName - the name of the column containing the start timestamps after the mapping of the source's tuples.
endTimestampColumnName - the name of the column containing the end timestamps after the mapping of the source's tuples.
globalMetaData - the initial metadata for the cursor to be returned. When it is specified as null a new empty composite metadata will be created.
Returns:
a cursor providing the mapped content of the given source.

getSource

public static <I,O> CursorSource<O> getSource(Cursor<I> cursor,
                                              Function<? super I,? extends O> mapping,
                                              Queue<O> queue,
                                              SourceProcessor processor,
                                              Function<?,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> metadataFactory)
Adapts a passive query processing operator for its use inside an active query graph. The cursor's elements are mapped using the given mapping function and inserted into the specified queue, that can be used to change the element's order. Thereafter a source based on the queue's elements is created that's activity is controlled by the given processor. At last, the source's metadata is generated by the given metadata factory and the source itself is returned.

Type Parameters:
I - the type of the cursor's elements.
O - the type of the source's elements.
Parameters:
cursor - the cursor providing the elements the source's elements are based on.
mapping - the mapping function used for mapping the cursor's elements to the source's elements.
queue - the queue used for storing the cursor's mapped elements (and possible changing the elements' order).
processor - the processor used for simulating the source's activity.
metadataFactory - a factory that is used for generating the source's metadata.
Returns:
a source providing the mapped (and possibly reordered) content of the given cursor.

getSource

public static <I,O> CursorSource<TemporalObject<O>> getSource(Cursor<I> cursor,
                                                              Function<? super I,? extends O> objectFactory,
                                                              Function<? super I,? extends TimeInterval> timeIntervalFactory,
                                                              Function<?,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> metadataFactory)
Adapts a passive query processing operator for its use inside an active query graph. The cursor's elements are mapped to temporal objects using the given factory methods and reordered according to its time intervals (primary ordered by start timestamps, secondary ordered by end timestamps). The activity of the returned source is simulated according to the start timestamps (the difference) of its elements.

Type Parameters:
I - the type of the cursor's elements.
O - the inner type of the source's temporal elements.
Parameters:
cursor - the cursor providing the elements the source's elements are based on.
objectFactory - the mapping function used for mapping the cursor's elements to the content of the source's temporal elements.
timeIntervalFactory - the mapping function used for mapping the cursor's elements to the timestamps of the source's temporal elements.
metadataFactory - a factory that is used for generating the source's metadata.
Returns:
a source providing the mapped and reordered content of the given cursor.

getSource

public static CursorSource<TemporalObject<Tuple>> getSource(MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> cursor,
                                                            int startTimestampColumnIndex,
                                                            int endTimestampColumnIndex,
                                                            CompositeMetaData<Object,Object> globalMetaData)
Adapts a passive query processing operator for its use inside an active query graph. The cursor's tuples are projected to its non-timestamp columns temporal with the specified start and end timestamps and reordered according to its time intervals (primary ordered by start timestamps, secondary ordered by end timestamps). The activity of the returned source is simulated according to the start timestamps (the difference) of its elements.

Parameters:
cursor - the cursor providing the tuples the source's temporal tuples are based on.
startTimestampColumnIndex - the index of the column containing the start timestamps of the cursor's tuples.
endTimestampColumnIndex - the index of the column containing the end timestamps of the cursor's tuples.
globalMetaData - the initial metadata for the source to be returned. When it is specified as null a new empty composite metadata will be created.
Returns:
a source providing the projected, temporal and reordered tuples of the given cursor.

getDefaultTranslator

public static QueryTranslator getDefaultTranslator()
Returns a default instance of this class. All factory methods defined in this class will be registered to this default instance, so it will be able to translate standard query graphs.

Returns:
a default instance of this class that is able to translate standard query graphs.

getSwitch

public Switch<Object,MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>> getSwitch()
Returns the current switch function in such a way as to enable users to add new factory methods.

Returns:
the current switch function in such a way as to enable users to add new factory methods.

setSwitch

public void setSwitch(Switch<Object,MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>> switchFunction)
Set the current switch function to the given one.

Parameters:
switchFunction - the new switch function that should be used for transforming query graphs into an appropriate implementation.

translate

public MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> translate(Node node)
Returns a new physical query plan representing the specified logical query graph. Every node of the logical graph is translated into an appropriate implementation.

Parameters:
node - the root node of the logical query graph to be translated.
Returns:
a new physical query plan representing the specified logical query graph.
